entry.title: Why this is the moment to accelerate Armenia-India ties

media:group.media:title: Why this is the moment to accelerate Armenia-India ties
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of the CivilNet podcast, Rananjay Anand, Secretary General of the Armenia‚ÄìIndia Business Council, talks about the growing but still underdeveloped relationship between Armenia and India. Anand discusses the shift in Indian public opinion and policy toward Armenia after recent strikes on Pakistan, known as Operation Sindoor. He addresses missed opportunities due to the lack of direct flights between the countries, and what is needed to take this relationship to the next level.
0:00- Introduction 1:03- Modern Armenia-Indian relations through Friendship NGO 4:04- Relationship dynamics after Pakistan terrorist attack & Operation Sindoor 8:04- More can be done to harness momentum in Armenia-India relations 9:30- Roadblock: Absence of direct Armenia-India flights 11:31- Growth potential from Indian tourists 14:40- Armenia-India Business Council, top sectors in Armenia 17:12- Positioning Armenia for Indian businesspeople 22:53- Degree of cultural awareness between Armenians and Indians 29:42- Effects of Indian boycott of Turkey & Azerbaijan on Armenia
